title: üìù Summary: Questions and Answers
lead: Congratulations on completing the first module! See below the main questions we explored and their answers.

a1.title: ‚ùì What does the customer expect when contacting us?
a1.text: The customer expects more than just solving the problem. They seek:
a1.l1: To be heard with attention and empathy
a1.l2: To receive fast and efficient service
a1.l3: To feel that the company cares about them
a1.l4: To have clarity about the next steps
a1.l5: To leave satisfied, even when the answer is not ideal

a2.title: ‚ùì What is the role of Customer Service beyond solving problems?
a2.text: Customer Service represents the company's voice in direct contact with the customer. More than an operational sector, it is an essential strategic area for:

a3.title: ‚ùì What are our team's responsibilities?
a3.l1: Multichannel Service: phone, email, chat and electronic means
a3.l2: Inbound Service: information, complaints, suggestions and compliments
a3.l3: Outbound Services: campaigns, card activation, profile updates
a3.l4: Management: organize data, prepare reports, propose improvements
a3.note: Note: Defining consumer protection laws is NOT the responsibility of Customer Service - Customer Service follows the laws.

a4.title: ‚ùì Why do response times matter?
a4.text: Well-defined deadlines ensure organization, predictability and efficiency. Correct registration of the service category is essential because the system calculates the deadline based on it.

conclusion.title: Module 1 Conclusion
conclusion.text: Now you understand why Customer Service is strategic for the company. In the next module, we will discover where to find the information the customer needs!
